item.title: Unit testing null parameter checks
item.description: We use constructor dependency injection throughout our application. This means that most service classes have constructors, which accept all dependencies in form of interfaces. They are then saved to private fields to be used while class methods are executed. Here is an example (all examples below are in C#):
